intro: Cavendishia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima Cavendish, is a species of flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Cactaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and poor soil conditions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
